titles.title: Tuition Tax Deduction Act of 1995
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a deduction for tuition and fees for undergraduate and postsecondary vocational education.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 10/26/1995--Introduced. Tuition Tax Deduction Act of 1995 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual a deduction in an amount equal to the qualified education expenses paid for tuition and fees for the taxpayer, spouse, or any dependents to one or more eligible undergraduate and postsecondary vocational schools. Limits the deduction to $5,000. Allows the deduction whether or not the taxpayer itemizes other deductions.
